item.description:
$90 gas/tolls.

SPEND the WEEKEND in ACADIA on the MAINE COAST in a Spacious Waterfront Cottage!

Kayaking, Hiking, Biking, Relaxing, Wining, Dining, Beachcombing, Swimming, Wildlife, Long Walks on Miles of Coastline, and ACADIA NATIONAL PARK right at your doorstep!
This 2500sf five-bedroom harbor-view cottage has everything you could want. There are amazing views from its

windows, decks & wrap-around porch. Tastfully decorated, it rests on a gently sloping hillside with commanding views of the harbor and dozens of islands. With south and southwesterly views, it receives sunshine all day and captivates with gorgeous sunsets each evening. Relish the calm as an evening fog rolls in and watch the daily parade of lobster boats sailing in and out of the harbor below.

3 Days/Nights: Arrive noon, Thursday 9/13. Depart noon, Sunday, 9/16 (we can hike or kayak all afternoon on Sun.)

The grill is waiting for lobster, steak, and sauteed shrimp scampi with beer or a glass of wine! The lawn slopes down to the water where its private dock awaits.

And it's a short stroll into the quaint village of Stonington with shops and restaurants. Ride your bike or walk down the street to the ferry and ride or hike miles of roads and trails on Isle Au Haut where a large portion of Acadia National Park lies.

The house even comes with its own kayaks or bring your own to enjoy the waters, islands, bald eagles, and harbor seals around Acadia. We can leave the boats right at the dock and launch at all tides whenever the notion strikes us for a sunrise or sunset paddle.

This beautiful home was recently renovated, and is wonderfully appointed. There are harbor, island, and ocean views from every room!

Stonington, Maine is a traditional Maine fishing and lobstering village located at the far end of lovely Deer Isle. You can buy fresh lobster right off the dock, pick up a bottle of wine or the newspaper at the local market, and enjoy a less frenzied time than at larger tourist destinations. But Stonington is modern enough to have good restaurants and shops to pass the time in. And the ferry to Isle au Haut and the many other nearby islands leaves three times a day from Stonington's small dock. Meanwhile, it's still an easy drive to Bar Harbor if you'd like to go.

Wildlife: The area is known for bald eagles, harbor seals, whales, and puffins - an elusive, clown-like bird that spends its life out to sea. You're likely to encounter eagles and seals while walking or kayaking close to shore. And Whale Watch and Puffin Watch tour boats leave from Stonington's harbor each day.

Lighthouse tours are also available.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The cost for 3 nights, Thursday, Sept 13 to Sunday, Sept 16:

BR1: Queen - Taken - (Larry)

BR2: Queen - $400 - (James)

BR3: Queen - $400 (Susan T)

BR4: 2 Twins - $250ea- (Di & Mary Ann)

BR5: 1 Twin - $325 - (Randy)

Living Room Couch - $200 - (Regina)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Send checks to: Larry Pilla, 21 Baker St. Dover, NH 03820-3101.  (Payment may also be made online for an additional $20.) *Bed is not reserved until I receive your check.

Cancellations are subject to the fees imposed by the rental agent. However, if all other beds are taken and I can fill your spot with a suitable replacement, deposits will be returned minus a $25 change fee.

Liability Release: AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup.

Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

REFUNDS: Refunds are not available after June 10 unless:

1. We can fill your spot with a suitable replacement, AND

2. All other beds are filled.

If both conditions are met, you will receive a full refund minus $25.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Classic Acadia Waterfront WEEKEND
